metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0102 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The keyring_detect_cycle_iterator function in security/keys/keyring.c inthe Linux kernel through 3.13.6 does not properly determine whetherkeyrings are identical, which allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (OOPS) via crafted keyctl commands.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0102` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-18-generic - 3.13.0-18.38
linux-image-3.13.0-18-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-18.38
linux-image-3.13.0-18-lowlatency - 3.13.0-18.38
linux-image-3.13.0-18-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-18.38
linux-image-3.13.0-18-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-18.38
linux-image-3.13.0-18-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-18.38
linux-image-3.13.0-18-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-18.38
linux-image-3.13.0-18-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-18.38
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-18-generic - 3.13.0-18.38
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-18.38').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
